Description: Fragment of a plain weave furnishing textile; probably the corner but also part of the extremity; the upper part of the plain weave has a fringe (13cm long) and c.19cm under this is a line of decorative loops of 4 supplementary wefts, 1 every 5 picks; the design is a succession of rectangles alternatively yellow, light blue, yellow, orange, yellow; c.4cm under this is a a band in a right angle with, at both ends, one dot with a finial (in purple); this element is made of 7 geometical motifs (lozenge or cross?) alternatively yellow-blue-orange and yellow-orange-blue on a yellow background and finally framed by a purple line; 3 edges are cut and ragged; plain weave: warp-undyedlinen (S/20), weft-undyed linen (S/8), supplementary weft loops-yellow, orange, light blue and purple wool (S/twisted/c.6mm)
Bibliographic references: Godlewski 1986 / Le monastère de St Phoibammon (no. 28, p.120, fig.97)
